revised_title: Photosensitized Polymerization of Vinyl Chloride in Tetrahydrofuran Solution: Determination of Kinetic Coefficients
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the photosensitized polymerization of vinyl chloride in tetrahydrofuran solution using intermittent illumination. They determined the kinetic coefficients for monomer termination, mutual termination, and propagation at different temperatures. The results provide insights into the reaction mechanisms and help improve the understanding of polymerization processes.
